I finally got around to playing this and it absolutely lived up to the hype. The extraordinary character development, gameplay and story kept me playing for hours at a time. I typically like open world games but it was actually pretty fun going on a journey that the writers and developers wanted me to go on. All in all I would recommend this game.
its a lot more methodical than i thougth it would be. certainly not a shootemup

BioShock Infinite still manages to hold up, even seven years after its original release. Graphically, it's still wonderful, the stylized designs of the characters and the city will prevent it from ever aging graphically. Gameplay wise, it's fantastic, and it has brought the series to new heights regarding vigors/plasmids and verticality. Finally, story wise, it's one of the best in the series, although you'll definitely get more out of it with a keen eye.

I would highly recommend playing BioShock Infinite

if you like bioshock because of its unique style, dont buy this one.

its just a mediocre shooter, with a very short story which only takes 10-15 hours because of the endless and boring shooting passages. 
the story itself is ok, but nothing special.
I loved Bioshock 1 and 2 , but this playthrough was just awefull and boring. 

would not recommend.

Bioshock Infinite the wonderfull 3th Game of this series.

The Setting is not as dark as the first two, and sometimes the story is quite confusing.

You play in first person, as you used to.
But what is new? Well! There are many new wappons and plasmides (called vigors)
And of course Elisabeth. Yes, you have a usefull companion now. She flipps you money and ammo, and the best, she will stay safe on her on. No protection needed!

So ready to explore the flying city?
If you havenÂ´t played the first two Bioshock games, i would recomend starting there, even if Infinite is a complete seperate story of his own.
